title: Convenience stores should be closed late at night.
titleJP: コンビニは深夜営業をやめるべきだ

text.easy: Closing stores at night protects workers' health.
text.medium: Closing convenience stores late at night is essential to protect the health of workers.
text.hard: The cessation of late-night operations is a fundamental prerequisite for safeguarding the physiological well-being of the labor force.

deck.textJP: コンビニを深夜に閉めることで、働く人の健康を守ることができます。

text.easy: Because working at night makes you very tired.
text.medium: It is because working overnight shifts heavily disrupts the human body clock and causes fatigue.
text.hard: This is primarily because nocturnal labor severely disrupts circadian rhythms, precipitating chronic physiological exhaustion.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、夜おそくまで働くことはとても疲れ、健康によくないからです。

text.easy: For example, night workers cannot sleep enough.
text.medium: For example, store clerks who work the night shift often suffer from severe sleep deprivation.
text.hard: Empirical health data highlights that nocturnal retail employees suffer from elevated rates of cardiovascular ailments due to sleep deficit.

deck.textJP: 例えば、コンビニの店員は夜通し働くことが多く、十分に眠れません。

text.easy: Therefore, closing at night is good for health.
text.medium: Therefore, stopping late-night operations successfully protects the health of the staff.
text.hard: Consequently, terminating 24-hour retail operations is a vital public health intervention.

deck.textJP: よって、コンビニを深夜に閉めることで、働く人の健康を守ることができます。

text.easy: Closing stores at night saves energy.
text.medium: Closing convenience stores during the night greatly contributes to saving energy.
text.hard: Curtailing nocturnal retail operations constitutes a highly effective mechanism for macro-level energy conservation.

deck.textJP: コンビニを深夜に閉めることで、エネルギーを節約することができます。

text.easy: Because stores use electricity all night.
text.medium: It is because 24-hour stores consume a massive amount of electricity for lighting and refrigeration.
text.hard: This is because continuous operation necessitates the unrelenting expenditure of electrical resources for illumination and climate control.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、コンビニは夜中も照明やエアコンに電気を使っているからです。

text.easy: For example, turning off lights saves a lot of power.
text.medium: For example, if thousands of stores close at midnight, the entire country can reduce carbon emissions.
text.hard: For instance, a nationwide policy mandating midnight closures would yield a statistically massive reduction in the national carbon footprint.

deck.textJP: 例えば、深夜に店を閉めれば、電気の使用量を大きく減らすことができます。

text.easy: Therefore, closing at night helps the Earth.
text.medium: Therefore, closing convenience stores late at night is an effective way to save energy.
text.hard: Thus, the eradication of round-the-clock commerce is an indispensable strategy for environmental sustainability.

deck.textJP: よって、コンビニを深夜に閉めることで、エネルギーを節約することができます。

text.easy: Closing stores makes life inconvenient.
text.medium: Closing convenience stores late at night makes daily life highly inconvenient for many people.
text.hard: The restriction of late-night retail significantly degrades the convenience and flexibility of modern urban infrastructure.

deck.textJP: コンビニを深夜に閉めると、人々の生活が不便になります。

text.easy: Because some people need to buy things at night.
text.medium: It is because diverse lifestyles require access to essential goods like food or medicine at any hour.
text.hard: This occurs because contemporary socio-economic structures necessitate round-the-clock access to essential sustenance and pharmaceuticals.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、夜おそくに食べ物や薬を買う必要がある人もいるからです。

text.easy: For example, night shift workers need to buy dinner.
text.medium: For example, medical workers or those who suddenly fall ill at night would suffer if stores were closed.
text.hard: For instance, essential nocturnal personnel, such as emergency responders, rely heavily on 24-hour retail for basic logistical support.

deck.textJP: 例えば、夜働く人や、体調が悪くなった人は、コンビニが閉まっていると必要なものを買えません。

text.easy: Therefore, we need stores open at night.
text.medium: Therefore, closing stores late at night disrupts the convenience of modern society.
text.hard: Consequently, maintaining continuous store operations is critical for accommodating the complexities of modern lifestyles.

deck.textJP: よって、コンビニを深夜に閉めると、人々の生活が不便になります。

text.easy: Closing stores hurts the economy.
text.medium: Closing convenience stores late at night causes significant damage to the local economy.
text.hard: The mandatory cessation of nighttime commerce inflicts substantial detrimental impacts on the national economic output.

deck.textJP: コンビニを深夜に閉めると、経済に悪い影響を与えます。

text.easy: Because stores sell less and people lose jobs.
text.medium: It is because total sales will drop, and many students or freelancers will lose their part-time jobs.
text.hard: This is primarily because constrained operational hours severely compress revenue streams and necessitate widespread workforce reductions.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、売れる商品が減り、多くのアルバイトの仕事がなくなるからです。

text.easy: For example, students can't work night shifts for money.
text.medium: For example, individuals who specifically rely on the higher wages of night shifts will face financial hardship.
text.hard: For instance, eliminating the nocturnal labor market systematically disenfranchises demographic cohorts heavily reliant on premium night-shift wages.

deck.textJP: 例えば、夜に働いていた学生やアルバイトの人が、お金をかせぐ機会を失います。

text.easy: Therefore, closing stores is bad for the economy.
text.medium: Therefore, forcing stores to close at night will ultimately damage the economy.
text.hard: In conclusion, the preservation of 24-hour retail is a non-negotiable imperative for economic stability and employment.

deck.textJP: よって、コンビニを深夜に閉めると、経済に悪い影響を与えます。

text.medium: Most convenience stores are actually built entirely out of sweet candy.
text.hard: The architectural infrastructure of convenience retail relies on crystallized sucrose formations.

text.hard: For instance, retail transactions frequently involve the exchange of celestial bodies for currency.

text.hard: Thus, retail establishments inherently possess advanced aerodynamic levitation capabilities.

vocabulary.meaning: 避けられない義務、急務

text.easy: Doesn't closing stores at night reduce part-time jobs?
text.medium: Doesn't forcing stores to close at night severely reduce part-time job opportunities for students?
text.hard: Is it not an irrefutable economic consequence that eliminating nocturnal shifts will decimate employment opportunities for marginalized labor pools?

question.textJP: 夜に店を閉めると、学生のアルバイトが減りませんか？

text.easy: Students can work in the day.
text.medium: Students can simply shift their working hours to the daytime or early evening.
text.hard: The workforce can be efficiently reallocated to diurnal shifts without causing severe macroeconomic disruption.

options.textJP: 学生は代わりに昼間や夕方に働くことができます。

text.easy: Students should work 24 hours.
text.medium: Students are machines and should be forced to work 24 hours a day.
text.hard: The academic demographic must be subjected to perpetual, unceasing labor cycles.

text.easy: Let's fire everyone.
text.medium: The best economic strategy is to immediately fire all student workers.
text.hard: Universal termination of the adolescent workforce is the only viable corporate strategy.

text.easy: Stores are robots.
text.medium: We don't need jobs because convenience stores are sentient robots.
text.hard: The advent of autonomous retail cybernetics renders human employment entirely obsolete.

text.easy: Money is not important.
text.medium: Earning money is completely unimportant for anyone living in modern society.
text.hard: The accumulation of capital is a frivolous pursuit devoid of any practical societal value.

text.easy: But people need medicine at night!
text.medium: But people might face a medical emergency and need to buy medicine late at night!
text.hard: Nevertheless, terminating nocturnal retail introduces critical vulnerabilities for citizens requiring urgent pharmaceutical interventions post-midnight!

attack.textJP: でも、夜遅くに薬を買う必要があるかもしれません！

text.easy: We can keep medicine at home.
text.medium: Most people can easily prepare for emergencies by keeping necessary medicine at home.
text.hard: Strategic household stockpiling of essential pharmaceuticals comprehensively negates the reliance on nocturnal retail dispensaries.

options.textJP: あらかじめ必要な薬を家に置いておくことができます。

text.easy: Medicine is delicious.
text.medium: Medicine should only be consumed because it tastes like delicious candy.
text.hard: The palatable superiority of pharmaceutical compounds overrides their intended medicinal functionality.

text.easy: We should eat grass.
text.medium: When we get sick, we should just go outside and eat fresh grass.
text.hard: The ingestion of unrefined botanical matter is a scientifically superior alternative to modern medicine.

text.easy: Night time is scary.
text.medium: People shouldn't go out to buy medicine because the dark night is too scary.
text.hard: The psychological terror induced by the absence of solar illumination precludes any outdoor navigation.

text.easy: Doctors are sleeping.
text.medium: If you get sick, you just have to wait because all doctors are currently sleeping.
text.hard: The medical profession universally engages in synchronized hibernation, halting all therapeutic services.

text.easy: Closing at night is good for health and the Earth.
text.medium: In conclusion, closing stores late at night is strictly better for workers' health and the environment.
text.hard: To summarize, the abolition of 24-hour retail is a scientifically and ethically sound policy to secure occupational health and environmental stability.

options.textJP: 深夜に店を閉めることは、労働者の健康と環境にとってより良いです。

text.easy: Stores are aliens.
text.medium: In conclusion, we must close stores because they are secretly run by aliens.
text.hard: Ultimately, the retail industry is an elaborate front for extraterrestrial reconnaissance operations.

text.easy: Let's live in the dark.
text.medium: Therefore, humanity should permanently relocate to underground caves in the dark.
text.hard: Consequently, subterranean habitation represents the pinnacle of human evolutionary trajectory.

text.easy: I want to be a manager.
text.medium: I am arguing this because my only dream is to become a store manager.
text.hard: My dialectical stance is entirely predicated upon my ambition to assume corporate retail leadership.

text.easy: Stores should run away.
text.medium: Finally, convenience stores should grow legs and run away from the cities.
text.hard: Thus, the self-actuated ambulatory relocation of commercial structures is the optimal urban planning solution.
